Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: These pauses were always preceded by the short P - P intervals and were usually followed by one or two P - P intervals of 0 . 92 - 0 . 95 s representing the basic sinus cycle .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| P - P intervals |
| Sinus cycle |

In this paragraph, the only chemical entities mentioned are "P - P intervals" which represent the intervals between two consecutive heartbeats or R-R intervals, specifically between two P waves in an electrocardiogram (ECG) trace. The term "sinus cycle" is not a chemical entity but rather a term used to describe the normal rhythm of heartbeats originating from the sinoatrial node.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| P - P intervals |

In this paragraph, the only chemical entity mentioned is "P - P intervals" which represent the intervals between two consecutive heartbeats or R-R intervals, specifically between two P waves in an electrocardiogram (ECG) trace. This entity is a chemical reference as the electrical activity of the heart is influenced by the ionic concentrations and membrane potentials of various ions such as sodium, potassium, and calcium.
